title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
desc: Bilbo Baggins' unexpected journey with dwarves to reclaim treasure from Smaug the dragon. The perfect introduction to Middle-earth, filled with riddles, adventure, and the discovery of a certain ring. Tolkien's world-building changed fantasy forever.
classic: Bilbo Baggins' unexpected journey with dwarves to reclaim treasure from Smaug the dragon. The perfect introduction to Middle-earth, filled with riddles, adventure, and the discovery of a certain ring. Tolkien's world-building changed fantasy forever.

title: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
desc: The epic begins as Frodo inherits the One Ring and sets out to destroy it in Mordor. The formation of the Fellowship - nine companions against the Dark Lord Sauron. Tolkien's masterpiece defined modern fantasy.
classic: The epic begins as Frodo inherits the One Ring and sets out to destroy it in Mordor. The formation of the Fellowship - nine companions against the Dark Lord Sauron. Tolkien's masterpiece defined modern fantasy.

title: The Two Towers
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
desc: The Fellowship is broken. Frodo and Sam continue toward Mordor with Gollum as guide, while Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli aid Rohan against Saruman. The Battle of Helm's Deep is unforgettable.
classic: The Fellowship is broken. Frodo and Sam continue toward Mordor with Gollum as guide, while Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli aid Rohan against Saruman. The Battle of Helm's Deep is unforgettable.

title: The Return of the King
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
desc: The final battle for Middle-earth. Aragorn claims his throne, the siege of Minas Tirith, and Frodo's final climb up Mount Doom. The perfect ending to the greatest fantasy trilogy ever written.
classic: The final battle for Middle-earth. Aragorn claims his throne, the siege of Minas Tirith, and Frodo's final climb up Mount Doom. The perfect ending to the greatest fantasy trilogy ever written.

title: The Silmarillion
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
desc: The creation myths and ancient history of Middle-earth. From the Music of the Ainur to the Fall of Gondolin, Tolkien's epic backstory for his world. For dedicated fans who want the full mythology.
classic: The creation myths and ancient history of Middle-earth. From the Music of the Ainur to the Fall of Gondolin, Tolkien's epic backstory for his world. For dedicated fans who want the full mythology.

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
author: Roald Dahl
desc: Charlie Bucket wins a golden ticket to Willy Wonka's mysterious chocolate factory. Five children, four brats, one winner. Oompa-Loompas, everlasting gobstoppers, and pure imagination. Dahl's most beloved creation.
classic: Charlie Bucket wins a golden ticket to Willy Wonka's mysterious chocolate factory. Five children, four brats, one winner. Oompa-Loompas, everlasting gobstoppers, and pure imagination. Dahl's most beloved creation.

title: Matilda
author: Roald Dahl
desc: A brilliant girl with telekinetic powers takes on her ignorant parents and tyrannical headmistress Miss Trunchbull. Celebrates intelligence, books, and standing up to bullies. Matilda's library love is inspiring.
classic: A brilliant girl with telekinetic powers takes on her ignorant parents and tyrannical headmistress Miss Trunchbull. Celebrates intelligence, books, and standing up to bullies. Matilda's library love is inspiring.

title: The BFG
author: Roald Dahl
desc: Sophie is kidnapped by the Big Friendly Giant who catches dreams and speaks in wonderful malapropisms. Together they stop the child-eating giants. Whizzpopping wonderful wordplay and genuine heart.
classic: Sophie is kidnapped by the Big Friendly Giant who catches dreams and speaks in wonderful malapropisms. Together they stop the child-eating giants. Whizzpopping wonderful wordplay and genuine heart.

title: James and the Giant Peach
author: Roald Dahl
desc: Orphan James escapes his awful aunts inside a magical giant peach with insect friends. Surreal adventure across the Atlantic. Pure Dahl imagination - dark beginnings, magical middle, triumphant ending.
classic: Orphan James escapes his awful aunts inside a magical giant peach with insect friends. Surreal adventure across the Atlantic. Pure Dahl imagination - dark beginnings, magical middle, triumphant ending.

title: The Witches
author: Roald Dahl
desc: A boy and his grandmother battle witches who plan to turn all children into mice. Genuinely scary but ultimately triumphant. Dahl's darkest children's book - witches with square feet and no toes!
classic: A boy and his grandmother battle witches who plan to turn all children into mice. Genuinely scary but ultimately triumphant. Dahl's darkest children's book - witches with square feet and no toes!

title: Fantastic Mr Fox
author: Roald Dahl
desc: Clever Mr. Fox outwits three horrible farmers - Boggis, Bunce, and Bean. Underground tunnels, family loyalty, and triumph of cunning over cruelty. Short, perfect, and infinitely rereadable.
classic: Clever Mr. Fox outwits three horrible farmers - Boggis, Bunce, and Bean. Underground tunnels, family loyalty, and triumph of cunning over cruelty. Short, perfect, and infinitely rereadable.

title: Danny the Champion of the World
author: Roald Dahl
desc: Danny and his father live in a caravan and poach pheasants from the horrible Mr. Hazell. A beautiful father-son story. Dahl called it his favorite of all his books.
classic: Danny and his father live in a caravan and poach pheasants from the horrible Mr. Hazell. A beautiful father-son story. Dahl called it his favorite of all his books.

title: George's Marvellous Medicine
author: Roald Dahl
desc: George creates a magical medicine to deal with his horrible grandmother. She grows to giant size! Anarchic, funny, and deeply satisfying wish-fulfillment for kids with difficult relatives.
classic: George creates a magical medicine to deal with his horrible grandmother. She grows to giant size! Anarchic, funny, and deeply satisfying wish-fulfillment for kids with difficult relatives.

title: The Twits
author: Roald Dahl
desc: Mr. and Mrs. Twit are the most disgusting couple in the world. They torture animals and each other. The Muggle-Wumps and the Roly-Poly Bird get revenge. Short, hilarious, and gloriously gross.
classic: Mr. and Mrs. Twit are the most disgusting couple in the world. They torture animals and each other. The Muggle-Wumps and the Roly-Poly Bird get revenge. Short, hilarious, and gloriously gross.

title: Esio Trot
author: Roald Dahl
desc: Shy Mr. Hoppy loves Mrs. Silver who loves her tortoise Alfie. Mr. Hoppy's elaborate plan to win her heart is sweet and clever. Dahl's gentlest story - pure romance for all ages.
classic: Shy Mr. Hoppy loves Mrs. Silver who loves her tortoise Alfie. Mr. Hoppy's elaborate plan to win her heart is sweet and clever. Dahl's gentlest story - pure romance for all ages.

title: Sharpe's Rifles
author: Bernard Cornwell
desc: Richard Sharpe's first adventure as an officer during the Peninsular War. From the ranks to Lieutenant through courage and cunning. Cornwell's authentic battle scenes and compelling anti-hero begin here.
classic: Richard Sharpe's first adventure as an officer during the Peninsular War. From the ranks to Lieutenant through courage and cunning. Cornwell's authentic battle scenes and compelling anti-hero begin here.

title: Sharpe's Eagle
author: Bernard Cornwell
desc: Sharpe captures a French Imperial Eagle at the Battle of Talavera. Incompetent British officers, French cavalry charges, and Sharpe's determination to prove himself. Napoleonic warfare at its finest.
classic: Sharpe captures a French Imperial Eagle at the Battle of Talavera. Incompetent British officers, French cavalry charges, and Sharpe's determination to prove himself. Napoleonic warfare at its finest.

title: Sharpe's Gold
author: Bernard Cornwell
desc: Sharpe's mission to find hidden Spanish gold behind enemy lines. Guerrilla warfare, treasure hunts, and survival against overwhelming odds. Adventure and history perfectly blended.
classic: Sharpe's mission to find hidden Spanish gold behind enemy lines. Guerrilla warfare, treasure hunts, and survival against overwhelming odds. Adventure and history perfectly blended.

title: Sharpe's Company
author: Bernard Cornwell
desc: The siege of Badajoz - one of the bloodiest battles of the Napoleonic Wars. Sharpe leads the Forlorn Hope in the desperate assault. Cornwell's most intense and brutal novel.
classic: The siege of Badajoz - one of the bloodiest battles of the Napoleonic Wars. Sharpe leads the Forlorn Hope in the desperate assault. Cornwell's most intense and brutal novel.

title: Sharpe's Sword
author: Bernard Cornwell
desc: Sharpe hunts a French spy at the Battle of Salamanca. Espionage, romance, and Wellington's greatest victory. The cavalry charge at Salamanca is spectacularly described.
classic: Sharpe hunts a French spy at the Battle of Salamanca. Espionage, romance, and Wellington's greatest victory. The cavalry charge at Salamanca is spectacularly described.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
desc: The boy who lived discovers he's a wizard on his 11th birthday. Hogwarts, Quidditch, friendship, and facing Voldemort. Rowling created a magical world that reignited global love of reading.
classic: The boy who lived discovers he's a wizard on his 11th birthday. Hogwarts, Quidditch, friendship, and facing Voldemort. Rowling created a magical world that reignited global love of reading.

title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
author: J.K. Rowling
desc: Something is petrifying students at Hogwarts. Harry hears voices in the walls and discovers he can speak Parseltongue. The mystery of Tom Riddle's diary and the Basilisk in the Chamber.
classic: Something is petrifying students at Hogwarts. Harry hears voices in the walls and discovers he can speak Parseltongue. The mystery of Tom Riddle's diary and the Basilisk in the Chamber.

title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
author: J.K. Rowling
desc: Sirius Black has escaped from Azkaban! Time-turners, Patronuses, werewolves, and the revelation that changes everything. Many fans' favorite - darker, more complex, brilliantly plotted.
classic: Sirius Black has escaped from Azkaban! Time-turners, Patronuses, werewolves, and the revelation that changes everything. Many fans' favorite - darker, more complex, brilliantly plotted.

title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
author: J.K. Rowling
desc: The Triwizard Tournament brings danger to Hogwarts. Harry faces dragons, merpeople, and a maze. The graveyard scene where Voldemort returns is terrifying. The series gets serious.
classic: The Triwizard Tournament brings danger to Hogwarts. Harry faces dragons, merpeople, and a maze. The graveyard scene where Voldemort returns is terrifying. The series gets serious.

title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
author: J.K. Rowling
desc: Harry's angriest year. Umbridge tortures students, Dumbledore's Army forms in secret, and the prophecy is revealed. The Battle of the Department of Mysteries and Sirius's death devastate.
classic: Harry's angriest year. Umbridge tortures students, Dumbledore's Army forms in secret, and the prophecy is revealed. The Battle of the Department of Mysteries and Sirius's death devastate.

title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
author: J.K. Rowling
desc: Harry learns about Horcruxes through Dumbledore's memories of Tom Riddle. The Half-Blood Prince's potions book, teenage romance, and Snape's ultimate betrayal on the Astronomy Tower.
classic: Harry learns about Horcruxes through Dumbledore's memories of Tom Riddle. The Half-Blood Prince's potions book, teenage romance, and Snape's ultimate betrayal on the Astronomy Tower.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
author: J.K. Rowling
desc: The final battle for the wizarding world. Horcrux hunting, the Deathly Hallows, sacrifices at Hogwarts, and the truth about Snape. "Always." The perfect ending to an epic series.
classic: The final battle for the wizarding world. Horcrux hunting, the Deathly Hallows, sacrifices at Hogwarts, and the truth about Snape. "Always." The perfect ending to an epic series.

title: Treasure Island
author: Robert Louis Stevenson
desc: Jim Hawkins finds a treasure map and sails with pirates. Long John Silver, parrots, buried treasure, and mutiny. The definitive pirate adventure that created every trope we know.
classic: Jim Hawkins finds a treasure map and sails with pirates. Long John Silver, parrots, buried treasure, and mutiny. The definitive pirate adventure that created every trope we know.

title: Robinson Crusoe
author: Daniel Defoe
desc: Shipwrecked on a deserted island for 28 years. Crusoe's survival, Friday's rescue, and eventual return home. The original survival story that inspired countless others.
classic: Shipwrecked on a deserted island for 28 years. Crusoe's survival, Friday's rescue, and eventual return home. The original survival story that inspired countless others.

title: The Swiss Family Robinson
author: Johann David Wyss
desc: A family shipwrecked builds an amazing treehouse life. Ingenious survival solutions, exotic animals, and family adventure. Victorian ingenuity and optimism at its finest.
classic: A family shipwrecked builds an amazing treehouse life. Ingenious survival solutions, exotic animals, and family adventure. Victorian ingenuity and optimism at its finest.

title: Kidnapped
author: Robert Louis Stevenson
desc: David Balfour is betrayed and kidnapped. Scottish Highland adventure, the murder of the Red Fox, and friendship with Alan Breck Stewart. Historical adventure perfection.
classic: David Balfour is betrayed and kidnapped. Scottish Highland adventure, the murder of the Red Fox, and friendship with Alan Breck Stewart. Historical adventure perfection.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
desc: Edmond Dantès is wrongfully imprisoned for 14 years, escapes, finds treasure, and executes perfect revenge. The greatest revenge story ever told. Epic in every sense.
classic: Edmond Dantès is wrongfully imprisoned for 14 years, escapes, finds treasure, and executes perfect revenge. The greatest revenge story ever told. Epic in every sense.

title: The Three Musketeers
author: Alexandre Dumas
desc: D'Artagnan joins the King's Musketeers - Athos, Porthos, and Aramis. "All for one and one for all!" Swordfights, romance, intrigue at the French court. Swashbuckling perfection.
classic: D'Artagnan joins the King's Musketeers - Athos, Porthos, and Aramis. "All for one and one for all!" Swordfights, romance, intrigue at the French court. Swashbuckling perfection.

title: The Man in the Iron Mask
author: Alexandre Dumas
desc: The final Musketeers adventure. A mysterious prisoner in an iron mask, Louis XIV's twin brother, and one last mission. The aging heroes' final stand is deeply moving.
classic: The final Musketeers adventure. A mysterious prisoner in an iron mask, Louis XIV's twin brother, and one last mission. The aging heroes' final stand is deeply moving.

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea
author: Jules Verne
desc: Captain Nemo's submarine Nautilus explores the world's oceans. Giant squid, underwater forests, lost Atlantis. Verne predicted submarines decades before they existed.
classic: Captain Nemo's submarine Nautilus explores the world's oceans. Giant squid, underwater forests, lost Atlantis. Verne predicted submarines decades before they existed.

title: Around the World in Eighty Days
author: Jules Verne
desc: Phileas Fogg bets he can circumnavigate the globe in 80 days. Racing against time by train, ship, and elephant. The ultimate travelogue and adventure against the clock.
classic: Phileas Fogg bets he can circumnavigate the globe in 80 days. Racing against time by train, ship, and elephant. The ultimate travelogue and adventure against the clock.

title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
author: Jules Verne
desc: Professor Lidenbrock and his nephew descend into an Icelandic volcano to explore the earth's interior. Prehistoric creatures, underground oceans, and scientific adventure.
classic: Professor Lidenbrock and his nephew descend into an Icelandic volcano to explore the earth's interior. Prehistoric creatures, underground oceans, and scientific adventure.

title: The Mysterious Island
author: Jules Verne
desc: Union prisoners escape in a hot air balloon and crash on a Pacific island. Using science and ingenuity to build civilization. Captain Nemo makes a surprise appearance!
classic: Union prisoners escape in a hot air balloon and crash on a Pacific island. Using science and ingenuity to build civilization. Captain Nemo makes a surprise appearance!

title: From the Earth to the Moon
author: Jules Verne
desc: The Baltimore Gun Club builds a giant cannon to shoot three men to the moon. Verne's incredibly accurate prediction of space travel a century early.
classic: The Baltimore Gun Club builds a giant cannon to shoot three men to the moon. Verne's incredibly accurate prediction of space travel a century early.

title: The War of the Worlds
author: H.G. Wells
desc: Martians invade Victorian England with heat-rays and tripods. The narrator's desperate survival and humanity's near-extinction. The first great alien invasion story.
classic: Martians invade Victorian England with heat-rays and tripods. The narrator's desperate survival and humanity's near-extinction. The first great alien invasion story.

title: The Time Machine
author: H.G. Wells
desc: The Time Traveller journeys to the year 802,701 and discovers humanity has split into Eloi and Morlocks. Haunting vision of evolution and class divide. Time travel invented here.
classic: The Time Traveller journeys to the year 802,701 and discovers humanity has split into Eloi and Morlocks. Haunting vision of evolution and class divide. Time travel invented here.

title: The Invisible Man
author: H.G. Wells
desc: Griffin discovers invisibility but descends into madness and violence. The price of unchecked scientific ambition. Wells's darkest exploration of science without ethics.
classic: Griffin discovers invisibility but descends into madness and violence. The price of unchecked scientific ambition. Wells's darkest exploration of science without ethics.

title: The Island of Doctor Moreau
author: H.G. Wells
desc: Shipwrecked Prendick discovers Moreau's island where animals are surgically transformed into humans. Horrifying exploration of vivisection and playing God.
classic: Shipwrecked Prendick discovers Moreau's island where animals are surgically transformed into humans. Horrifying exploration of vivisection and playing God.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
desc: Count Dracula comes to England. Jonathan Harker's escape from Castle Dracula, Lucy's transformation, Van Helsing's vampire hunt. The vampire novel that defined all others.
classic: Count Dracula comes to England. Jonathan Harker's escape from Castle Dracula, Lucy's transformation, Van Helsing's vampire hunt. The vampire novel that defined all others.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
desc: Victor Frankenstein creates life and abandons his creature. The monster's tragic search for acceptance and revenge. Written at 18, Shelley created science fiction and explored what makes us human.
classic: Victor Frankenstein creates life and abandons his creature. The monster's tragic search for acceptance and revenge. Written at 18, Shelley created science fiction and explored what makes us human.

title: The Strange Case of Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde
author: Robert Louis Stevenson
desc: Dr. Jekyll's potion transforms him into the evil Mr. Hyde. The duality of human nature explored through Victorian London fog and violence. A psychological horror masterpiece.
classic: Dr. Jekyll's potion transforms him into the evil Mr. Hyde. The duality of human nature explored through Victorian London fog and violence. A psychological horror masterpiece.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
desc: Dorian's portrait ages while he stays young and beautiful, growing corrupt and evil. Wilde's only novel is brilliant horror about vanity, art, and the price of immorality.
classic: Dorian's portrait ages while he stays young and beautiful, growing corrupt and evil. Wilde's only novel is brilliant horror about vanity, art, and the price of immorality.

title: The Turn of the Screw
author: Henry James
desc: A governess sees ghosts at a remote estate. Are they real or is she mad? James's ambiguous ghost story is psychological horror at its finest.
classic: A governess sees ghosts at a remote estate. Are they real or is she mad? James's ambiguous ghost story is psychological horror at its finest.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
desc: Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy overcome pride and prejudice to find love. The most famous romance in English literature. Austen's wit, social commentary, and perfect plotting never get old.
classic: Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy overcome pride and prejudice to find love. The most famous romance in English literature. Austen's wit, social commentary, and perfect plotting never get old.

title: Emma
author: Jane Austen
desc: Emma Woodhouse meddles in everyone's love life while missing her own. Austen's most perfectly constructed comedy. Emma's journey from matchmaker to self-awareness is delightful.
classic: Emma Woodhouse meddles in everyone's love life while missing her own. Austen's most perfectly constructed comedy. Emma's journey from matchmaker to self-awareness is delightful.

title: Sense and Sensibility
author: Jane Austen
desc: The Dashwood sisters - practical Elinor and romantic Marianne - navigate love and loss. Austen explores the balance between emotion and reason with trademark wit.
classic: The Dashwood sisters - practical Elinor and romantic Marianne - navigate love and loss. Austen explores the balance between emotion and reason with trademark wit.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
desc: Jane's journey from orphan to governess to Rochester's almost-bride. "Reader, I married him." Gothic romance with a strong feminist heroine. The madwoman in the attic is unforgettable.
classic: Jane's journey from orphan to governess to Rochester's almost-bride. "Reader, I married him." Gothic romance with a strong feminist heroine. The madwoman in the attic is unforgettable.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
desc: Heathcliff and Catherine's destructive passion spans generations on the Yorkshire moors. Dark, violent, obsessive love. Nothing else in literature is quite like it.
classic: Heathcliff and Catherine's destructive passion spans generations on the Yorkshire moors. Dark, violent, obsessive love. Nothing else in literature is quite like it.

title: The Tenant of Wildfell Hall
author: Anne Brontë
desc: Helen flees her abusive husband with her son. A shocking portrayal of domestic abuse and alcoholism for 1848. Anne Brontë's brave, feminist novel deserves more recognition.
classic: Helen flees her abusive husband with her son. A shocking portrayal of domestic abuse and alcoholism for 1848. Anne Brontë's brave, feminist novel deserves more recognition.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
desc: Pip's journey from forge to gentleman, driven by mysterious expectations. Miss Havisham in her wedding dress, Magwitch the convict, and Estella's cold beauty. Dickens's most personal novel.
classic: Pip's journey from forge to gentleman, driven by mysterious expectations. Miss Havisham in her wedding dress, Magwitch the convict, and Estella's cold beauty. Dickens's most personal novel.

title: David Copperfield
author: Charles Dickens
desc: Dickens's favorite of his own novels. David's journey from childhood to author mirrors Dickens's life. Micawber, Uriah Heep, and "Barkis is willin'" are immortal characters.
classic: Dickens's favorite of his own novels. David's journey from childhood to author mirrors Dickens's life. Micawber, Uriah Heep, and "Barkis is willin'" are immortal characters.

title: Oliver Twist
author: Charles Dickens
desc: "Please sir, I want some more." Orphan Oliver escapes the workhouse only to fall in with Fagin's gang of thieves. Dickens exposes Victorian poverty and child exploitation.
classic: "Please sir, I want some more." Orphan Oliver escapes the workhouse only to fall in with Fagin's gang of thieves. Dickens exposes Victorian poverty and child exploitation.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
desc: "It was the best of times, it was the worst of times." London and Paris during the French Revolution. Sydney Carton's sacrifice at the guillotine is deeply moving.
classic: "It was the best of times, it was the worst of times." London and Paris during the French Revolution. Sydney Carton's sacrifice at the guillotine is deeply moving.

title: A Christmas Carol
author: Charles Dickens
desc: Scrooge's transformation from miser to benefactor through visits from three ghosts. "God bless us, every one!" Dickens defined the spirit of Christmas. Tiny Tim, Bob Cratchit, and redemption.
classic: Scrooge's transformation from miser to benefactor through visits from three ghosts. "God bless us, every one!" Dickens defined the spirit of Christmas. Tiny Tim, Bob Cratchit, and redemption.

author: George Orwell
desc: Big Brother is watching. Winston Smith rebels in a totalitarian state where thought is crime. Room 101, Thought Police, doublespink, and "War is Peace." Orwell's nightmare vision warns of surveillance and truth manipulation.
classic: Big Brother is watching. Winston Smith rebels in a totalitarian state where thought is crime. Room 101, Thought Police, doublespink, and "War is Peace." Orwell's nightmare vision warns of surveillance and truth manipulation.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
desc: "All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others." Farm animals revolt against humans then descend into tyranny. Orwell's brilliant allegory of Soviet totalitarianism.
classic: "All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others." Farm animals revolt against humans then descend into tyranny. Orwell's brilliant allegory of Soviet totalitarianism.

title: Lord of the Flies
author: William Golding
desc: British schoolboys stranded on an island descend from civilization into savagery. Ralph, Piggy, Jack, and the Beast. Golding's dark exploration of human nature - we're all capable of evil.
classic: British schoolboys stranded on an island descend from civilization into savagery. Ralph, Piggy, Jack, and the Beast. Golding's dark exploration of human nature - we're all capable of evil.

title: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
author: C.S. Lewis
desc: Four children enter Narnia through a wardrobe. "Always winter but never Christmas" until Aslan returns. Turkish Delight, talking animals, and Aslan's sacrifice. Magic, allegory, and adventure perfectly blended.
classic: Four children enter Narnia through a wardrobe. "Always winter but never Christmas" until Aslan returns. Turkish Delight, talking animals, and Aslan's sacrifice. Magic, allegory, and adventure perfectly blended.

title: Prince Caspian
author: C.S. Lewis
desc: The Pevensies return to find centuries have passed. Prince Caspian fights to reclaim Narnia from his uncle. The Old Narnians - dwarfs, fauns, and talking beasts - need saving again.
classic: The Pevensies return to find centuries have passed. Prince Caspian fights to reclaim Narnia from his uncle. The Old Narnians - dwarfs, fauns, and talking beasts - need saving again.

title: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader
author: C.S. Lewis
desc: Lucy, Edmund, and annoying cousin Eustace sail to the End of the World. Islands of adventure, Eustace's dragon transformation, and the search for seven lost lords. Many fans' favorite Narnia book.
classic: Lucy, Edmund, and annoying cousin Eustace sail to the End of the World. Islands of adventure, Eustace's dragon transformation, and the search for seven lost lords. Many fans' favorite Narnia book.

title: The Silver Chair
author: C.S. Lewis
desc: Eustace and Jill search for missing Prince Rilian in the underground realm. Puddleglum the Marshwiggle is one of Lewis's best creations. Dark, atmospheric, brilliant.
classic: Eustace and Jill search for missing Prince Rilian in the underground realm. Puddleglum the Marshwiggle is one of Lewis's best creations. Dark, atmospheric, brilliant.

title: The Horse and His Boy
author: C.S. Lewis
desc: Shasta and talking horse Bree escape slavery and discover Shasta's true identity. Adventure in Calormen and a desperate ride to save Narnia. Exciting standalone story.
classic: Shasta and talking horse Bree escape slavery and discover Shasta's true identity. Adventure in Calormen and a desperate ride to save Narnia. Exciting standalone story.

title: The Magician's Nephew
author: C.S. Lewis
desc: The creation of Narnia! Digory and Polly witness Aslan singing the world into existence. How the lamppost got there, the origin of the White Witch. Prequel brilliance.
classic: The creation of Narnia! Digory and Polly witness Aslan singing the world into existence. How the lamppost got there, the origin of the White Witch. Prequel brilliance.

title: The Last Battle
author: C.S. Lewis
desc: Narnia's end times. The false Aslan, the stable door, and "further up and further in!" The apocalyptic finale to the series - sad, triumphant, and deeply theological.
classic: Narnia's end times. The false Aslan, the stable door, and "further up and further in!" The apocalyptic finale to the series - sad, triumphant, and deeply theological.

title: The Colour of Magic
author: Terry Pratchett
desc: Rincewind the wizard and Twoflower the tourist explore the Discworld. Pratchett's first novel introduces the flat world carried by four elephants on a giant turtle. Hilarious fantasy satire begins.
classic: Rincewind the wizard and Twoflower the tourist explore the Discworld. Pratchett's first novel introduces the flat world carried by four elephants on a giant turtle. Hilarious fantasy satire begins.

title: Mort
author: Terry Pratchett
desc: Mort becomes Death's apprentice but falls for a princess who's supposed to die. Pratchett's breakthrough novel - funny, philosophical, and touching. Death becomes one of literature's best characters.
classic: Mort becomes Death's apprentice but falls for a princess who's supposed to die. Pratchett's breakthrough novel - funny, philosophical, and touching. Death becomes one of literature's best characters.

title: Guards! Guards!
author: Terry Pratchett
desc: The Ankh-Morpork City Watch versus a dragon. Introduces Sam Vimes, Carrot, and the best police procedural in fantasy. Pratchett's masterful blend of comedy and social commentary.
classic: The Ankh-Morpork City Watch versus a dragon. Introduces Sam Vimes, Carrot, and the best police procedural in fantasy. Pratchett's masterful blend of comedy and social commentary.

title: Small Gods
author: Terry Pratchett
desc: The Great God Om is reduced to a tortoise with one believer. Pratchett's brilliant satire of organized religion, faith, and the nature of belief. Standalone Discworld masterpiece.
classic: The Great God Om is reduced to a tortoise with one believer. Pratchett's brilliant satire of organized religion, faith, and the nature of belief. Standalone Discworld masterpiece.

title: Going Postal
author: Terry Pratchett
desc: Con man Moist von Lipwig must revive the Post Office. Victorian technology meets fantasy. Pratchett's later work shows his mastery - funny, clever, and surprisingly moving.
classic: Con man Moist von Lipwig must revive the Post Office. Victorian technology meets fantasy. Pratchett's later work shows his mastery - funny, clever, and surprisingly moving.

title: Northern Lights (The Golden Compass)
author: Philip Pullman
desc: Lyra Belacqua and her daemon Pantalaimon adventure to the Arctic to rescue kidnapped children. Armoured bears, witches, and the mysterious Dust. Dark, complex, brilliant.
classic: Lyra Belacqua and her daemon Pantalaimon adventure to the Arctic to rescue kidnapped children. Armoured bears, witches, and the mysterious Dust. Dark, complex, brilliant.

title: The Subtle Knife
author: Philip Pullman
desc: Lyra meets Will who possesses a knife that cuts between worlds. The war escalates, and the children's role becomes clear. Pullman's darkest, most complex middle volume.
classic: Lyra meets Will who possesses a knife that cuts between worlds. The war escalates, and the children's role becomes clear. Pullman's darkest, most complex middle volume.

title: The Amber Spyglass
author: Philip Pullman
desc: The final battle against the Authority. Lyra and Will journey to the Land of the Dead. Pullman's controversial, moving conclusion - love, sacrifice, and growing up.
classic: The final battle against the Authority. Lyra and Will journey to the Land of the Dead. Pullman's controversial, moving conclusion - love, sacrifice, and growing up.

title: Artemis Fowl
author: Eoin Colfer
desc: 12-year-old criminal mastermind Artemis kidnaps a fairy for ransom. High-tech fantasy mixing Irish folklore with sci-fi gadgets. Fast, funny, and clever.
classic: 12-year-old criminal mastermind Artemis kidnaps a fairy for ransom. High-tech fantasy mixing Irish folklore with sci-fi gadgets. Fast, funny, and clever.

title: Artemis Fowl: The Arctic Incident
author: Eoin Colfer
desc: Artemis teams with Holly Short to rescue his father from the Russian Mafia. The Artemis-Holly partnership begins. Action-packed sequel.
classic: Artemis teams with Holly Short to rescue his father from the Russian Mafia. The Artemis-Holly partnership begins. Action-packed sequel.

title: The Lightning Thief
author: Rick Riordan
desc: Percy Jackson discovers he's a demigod - son of Poseidon. Greek gods in modern America! Quest to prevent a war between Zeus, Poseidon, and Hades. Adventure, humor, and mythology.
classic: Percy Jackson discovers he's a demigod - son of Poseidon. Greek gods in modern America! Quest to prevent a war between Zeus, Poseidon, and Hades. Adventure, humor, and mythology.

title: The Sea of Monsters
author: Rick Riordan
desc: Percy's quest to find the Golden Fleece to save Camp Half-Blood. Cyclops brother Tyson joins the adventure. Greek myths reimagined brilliantly.
classic: Percy's quest to find the Golden Fleece to save Camp Half-Blood. Cyclops brother Tyson joins the adventure. Greek myths reimagined brilliantly.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
desc: Katniss volunteers for the deadly Hunger Games to save her sister. 24 tributes, one survivor. Collins's critique of reality TV and totalitarianism captivated millions. "May the odds be ever in your favor."
classic: Katniss volunteers for the deadly Hunger Games to save her sister. 24 tributes, one survivor. Collins's critique of reality TV and totalitarianism captivated millions. "May the odds be ever in your favor."

title: Catching Fire
author: Suzanne Collins
desc: The Quarter Quell forces Katniss back into the arena with past victors. The rebellion begins to spark. The best book in the trilogy - tense, clever, explosive ending.
classic: The Quarter Quell forces Katniss back into the arena with past victors. The rebellion begins to spark. The best book in the trilogy - tense, clever, explosive ending.

title: Mockingjay
author: Suzanne Collins
desc: Katniss becomes the Mockingjay - symbol of the rebellion against the Capitol. War, propaganda, and the cost of revolution. Dark, challenging conclusion that doesn't shy from consequences.
classic: Katniss becomes the Mockingjay - symbol of the rebellion against the Capitol. War, propaganda, and the cost of revolution. Dark, challenging conclusion that doesn't shy from consequences.

title: Divergent
author: Veronica Roth
desc: Tris chooses Dauntless faction and discovers she's Divergent - dangerous in a society demanding conformity. Initiation, Four, and rebellion. Fast-paced dystopian thriller.
classic: Tris chooses Dauntless faction and discovers she's Divergent - dangerous in a society demanding conformity. Initiation, Four, and rebellion. Fast-paced dystopian thriller.

title: The Maze Runner
author: James Dashner
desc: Thomas wakes in the Glade surrounded by a deadly maze. Gladers search for escape while fighting mysterious Grievers. Post-apocalyptic mystery with relentless tension.
classic: Thomas wakes in the Glade surrounded by a deadly maze. Gladers search for escape while fighting mysterious Grievers. Post-apocalyptic mystery with relentless tension.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
desc: Hazel and Gus fall in love while battling cancer. Amsterdam, Peter Van Houten, and "Okay? Okay." Heartbreaking, funny, and beautifully written. Green makes tragedy meaningful.
classic: Hazel and Gus fall in love while battling cancer. Amsterdam, Peter Van Houten, and "Okay? Okay." Heartbreaking, funny, and beautifully written. Green makes tragedy meaningful.

title: Looking for Alaska
author: John Green
desc: Miles goes to boarding school and meets the enigmatic Alaska Young. Before and After. A tragedy changes everything. Green's debut explores grief, guilt, and forgiveness.
classic: Miles goes to boarding school and meets the enigmatic Alaska Young. Before and After. A tragedy changes everything. Green's debut explores grief, guilt, and forgiveness.

title: Paper Towns
author: John Green
desc: Quentin follows clues left by his crush Margo who's disappeared. Road trip to find her and himself. Green's meditation on seeing people as they really are, not as we imagine them.
classic: Quentin follows clues left by his crush Margo who's disappeared. Road trip to find her and himself. Green's meditation on seeing people as they really are, not as we imagine them.

title: Eleanor & Park
author: Rainbow Rowell
desc: Two misfits fall in love on the school bus in 1986. Comics, mixtapes, and first love against family struggles. Raw, real, and beautiful.
classic: Two misfits fall in love on the school bus in 1986. Comics, mixtapes, and first love against family struggles. Raw, real, and beautiful.

title: Where the Wild Things Are
author: Maurice Sendak
desc: Max sails to the land of Wild Things and becomes their king. A picture book about imagination, anger, and unconditional love. Sendak's masterpiece in minimal words.
classic: Max sails to the land of Wild Things and becomes their king. A picture book about imagination, anger, and unconditional love. Sendak's masterpiece in minimal words.

title: The Giving Tree
author: Shel Silverstein
desc: A tree loves a boy and gives everything. Controversial - selfless love or exploitation? Silverstein's simple story sparks endless debate about relationships and sacrifice.
classic: A tree loves a boy and gives everything. Controversial - selfless love or exploitation? Silverstein's simple story sparks endless debate about relationships and sacrifice.

title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
author: Eric Carle
desc: A caterpillar eats through the week and transforms into a butterfly. Carle's colorful collage art and simple story teach counting, days, and metamorphosis. Beloved for 50+ years.
classic: A caterpillar eats through the week and transforms into a butterfly. Carle's colorful collage art and simple story teach counting, days, and metamorphosis. Beloved for 50+ years.

title: The Tale of Peter Rabbit
author: Beatrix Potter
desc: Naughty Peter disobeys his mother and raids Mr. McGregor's garden. Nearly becomes rabbit pie! Potter's watercolors and gentle storytelling created the modern picture book.
classic: Naughty Peter disobeys his mother and raids Mr. McGregor's garden. Nearly becomes rabbit pie! Potter's watercolors and gentle storytelling created the modern picture book.

title: Winnie-the-Pooh
author: A.A. Milne
desc: Pooh Bear and friends in the Hundred Acre Wood. Honey, Eeyore's gloom, Piglet's bravery, and Tigger's bouncing. Milne's gentle stories hide surprising wisdom about friendship and life.
classic: Pooh Bear and friends in the Hundred Acre Wood. Honey, Eeyore's gloom, Piglet's bravery, and Tigger's bouncing. Milne's gentle stories hide surprising wisdom about friendship and life.

title: The House at Pooh Corner
author: A.A. Milne
desc: More Pooh adventures including Tigger's arrival. Christopher Robin's farewell as he grows up is one of literature's most poignant endings. "You're braver than you believe."
classic: More Pooh adventures including Tigger's arrival. Christopher Robin's farewell as he grows up is one of literature's most poignant endings. "You're braver than you believe."

title: The Wind in the Willows
author: Kenneth Grahame
desc: Mole, Rat, Badger, and Toad's adventures along the riverbank. Toad's wild ride, Badger's wisdom, and "messing about in boats." Captures English countryside and friendship beautifully.
classic: Mole, Rat, Badger, and Toad's adventures along the riverbank. Toad's wild ride, Badger's wisdom, and "messing about in boats." Captures English countryside and friendship beautifully.

title: Charlotte's Web
author: E.B. White
desc: Spider Charlotte saves Wilbur the pig by writing words in her web. "Some Pig." "Radiant." "Humble." Friendship, death, and life's cycle told with humor and heart. Timeless.
classic: Spider Charlotte saves Wilbur the pig by writing words in her web. "Some Pig." "Radiant." "Humble." Friendship, death, and life's cycle told with humor and heart. Timeless.

title: Stuart Little
author: E.B. White
desc: A mouse born to human parents has adventures in New York. Stuart's car, Margalo the bird, and the journey north. White's first novel is charming and slightly melancholy.
classic: A mouse born to human parents has adventures in New York. Stuart's car, Margalo the bird, and the journey north. White's first novel is charming and slightly melancholy.

title: The Trumpet of the Swan
author: E.B. White
desc: Louis the swan is born without a voice. His father steals a trumpet so Louis can sing. White's last novel is gentle, funny, and touching.
classic: Louis the swan is born without a voice. His father steals a trumpet so Louis can sing. White's last novel is gentle, funny, and touching.

title: Ramona the Pest
author: Beverly Cleary
desc: Ramona Quimby starts kindergarten and causes chaos. Pulling Susan's boing-boing curls, the Superintendent, and learning to read. Cleary captures childhood perfectly.
classic: Ramona Quimby starts kindergarten and causes chaos. Pulling Susan's boing-boing curls, the Superintendent, and learning to read. Cleary captures childhood perfectly.

title: Henry Huggins
author: Beverly Cleary
desc: Henry finds stray dog Ribsy and adventures on Klickitat Street begin. Cleary's first novel started 40+ books about normal kids in 1950s Portland. Real and relatable.
classic: Henry finds stray dog Ribsy and adventures on Klickitat Street begin. Cleary's first novel started 40+ books about normal kids in 1950s Portland. Real and relatable.

title: Are You There God? It's Me, Margaret
author: Judy Blume
desc: Margaret navigates puberty, periods, and religion. Blume's groundbreaking honesty about growing up female. Banned, challenged, and beloved for 50+ years.
classic: Margaret navigates puberty, periods, and religion. Blume's groundbreaking honesty about growing up female. Banned, challenged, and beloved for 50+ years.

title: Tales of a Fourth Grade Nothing
author: Judy Blume
desc: Peter's little brother Fudge causes chaos. The turtle-swallowing scene is unforgettable. Blume's humor about sibling rivalry is spot-on.
classic: Peter's little brother Fudge causes chaos. The turtle-swallowing scene is unforgettable. Blume's humor about sibling rivalry is spot-on.

title: Holes
author: Louis Sachar
desc: Stanley is sent to Camp Green Lake to dig holes. Past and present storylines weave together brilliantly. Kissin' Kate Barlow, yellow-spotted lizards, and destiny. Perfectly constructed.
classic: Stanley is sent to Camp Green Lake to dig holes. Past and present storylines weave together brilliantly. Kissin' Kate Barlow, yellow-spotted lizards, and destiny. Perfectly constructed.

title: Wayside School is Falling Down
author: Louis Sachar
desc: Weird stories from the 30-story school built sideways. Dead rats, Maurecia's ice cream addiction, and the 19th floor that doesn't exist. Surreal and hilarious.
classic: Weird stories from the 30-story school built sideways. Dead rats, Maurecia's ice cream addiction, and the 19th floor that doesn't exist. Surreal and hilarious.

title: Hatchet
author: Gary Paulsen
desc: 13-year-old Brian survives a plane crash in Canadian wilderness with only a hatchet. 54 days of survival - fire, shelter, food. Gripping adventure that teaches resilience.
classic: 13-year-old Brian survives a plane crash in Canadian wilderness with only a hatchet. 54 days of survival - fire, shelter, food. Gripping adventure that teaches resilience.

title: Brian's Winter
author: Gary Paulsen
desc: What if Brian wasn't rescued? Surviving winter in the wilderness with bow and arrows. Paulsen's alternative sequel is even more challenging than Hatchet.
classic: What if Brian wasn't rescued? Surviving winter in the wilderness with bow and arrows. Paulsen's alternative sequel is even more challenging than Hatchet.

title: Where the Red Fern Grows
author: Wilson Rawls
desc: Billy trains coon hounds Old Dan and Little Ann. The mountain lion fight and the red fern legend. Rawls's dog story is heartbreaking and unforgettable.
classic: Billy trains coon hounds Old Dan and Little Ann. The mountain lion fight and the red fern legend. Rawls's dog story is heartbreaking and unforgettable.

title: Summer of the Monkeys
author: Wilson Rawls
desc: Jay Berry tries to capture escaped circus monkeys for reward money. Funny, adventurous, and touching. Rawls's second novel shows his range beyond tragedy.
classic: Jay Berry tries to capture escaped circus monkeys for reward money. Funny, adventurous, and touching. Rawls's second novel shows his range beyond tragedy.

title: Because of Winn-Dixie
author: Kate DiCamillo
desc: Opal and her dog Winn-Dixie make friends in small-town Florida. Sweet, sad, and hopeful. DiCamillo's debut about loneliness and connection.
classic: Opal and her dog Winn-Dixie make friends in small-town Florida. Sweet, sad, and hopeful. DiCamillo's debut about loneliness and connection.

title: The Tale of Despereaux
author: Kate DiCamillo
desc: A mouse, a princess, some soup, and a spool of thread. Despereaux the brave mouse rescues Princess Pea. DiCamillo's fairy tale is charming and bittersweet.
classic: A mouse, a princess, some soup, and a spool of thread. Despereaux the brave mouse rescues Princess Pea. DiCamillo's fairy tale is charming and bittersweet.

title: Tuck Everlasting
author: Natalie Babbitt
desc: Winnie meets the Tuck family who drank from a spring that grants immortality. Would you choose eternal life? Babbitt's philosophical novel explores mortality beautifully.
classic: Winnie meets the Tuck family who drank from a spring that grants immortality. Would you choose eternal life? Babbitt's philosophical novel explores mortality beautifully.

title: A Wrinkle in Time
author: Madeleine L'Engle
desc: Meg, Charles Wallace, and Calvin tesseract through space to rescue Meg's father. Mrs. Whatsit, Mrs. Who, Mrs. Which, and the fight against IT. Groundbreaking sci-fi for young readers.
classic: Meg, Charles Wallace, and Calvin tesseract through space to rescue Meg's father. Mrs. Whatsit, Mrs. Who, Mrs. Which, and the fight against IT. Groundbreaking sci-fi for young readers.

title: A Wind in the Door
author: Madeleine L'Engle
desc: Meg journeys into mitochondria to save Charles Wallace. Proginoskes the cherubim and cellular adventure. L'Engle blends science and spirituality brilliantly.
classic: Meg journeys into mitochondria to save Charles Wallace. Proginoskes the cherubim and cellular adventure. L'Engle blends science and spirituality brilliantly.

title: The Giver
author: Lois Lowry
desc: Jonas receives memories from the Giver in a colorless, emotionless society. Pain, pleasure, color, and choice flood in. Lowry's dystopia is subtle and profound.
classic: Jonas receives memories from the Giver in a colorless, emotionless society. Pain, pleasure, color, and choice flood in. Lowry's dystopia is subtle and profound.

title: Number the Stars
author: Lois Lowry
desc: Annemarie helps hide her Jewish friend Ellen during Nazi occupation of Denmark. Brave girl, terrifying times. Lowry's WWII novel for middle readers is powerful.
classic: Annemarie helps hide her Jewish friend Ellen during Nazi occupation of Denmark. Brave girl, terrifying times. Lowry's WWII novel for middle readers is powerful.

title: Gathering Blue
author: Lois Lowry
desc: Kira the weaver discovers the truth about her village. Companion to The Giver exploring art, disability, and truth in different dystopia.
classic: Kira the weaver discovers the truth about her village. Companion to The Giver exploring art, disability, and truth in different dystopia.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
desc: Paul Atreides becomes Muad'Dib on desert planet Arrakis. Sandworms, spice, and galactic politics. Herbert's ecological masterpiece revolutionized sci-fi with complex world-building and philosophy.
classic: The greatest science fiction novel ever written. Herbert created an entire ecosystem, religion, and political system. Dune explores ecology, religion, and power with unmatched depth.

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
desc: Hari Seldon uses psychohistory to predict the fall of the Galactic Empire and establishes the Foundation to preserve knowledge. Asimov's epic spans centuries.
classic: Asimov's Foundation trilogy won the Hugo for 'Best All-Time Series.' Psychohistory - predicting the future through mathematics - influenced generations of scientists and writers.

title: Ender's Game
author: Orson Scott Card
desc: Child genius Ender Wiggin is trained to command Earth's fleet against alien Formics. Battle School, the final test, and the devastating truth. Military sci-fi perfection.
classic: Won both Hugo and Nebula Awards. Card's exploration of child soldiers, genius, and the morality of war resonates powerfully. The twist ending is unforgettable.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
desc: Hacker Case jacks into cyberspace for one last job. Gibson invented cyberpunk, predicted the internet, and created The Matrix before it existed. Neon-noir future.
classic: The book that invented cyberspace and launched cyberpunk. Won the 'triple crown' - Hugo, Nebula, and Philip K. Dick Awards. Gibson saw our digital future in 1984.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
desc: Arthur Dent escapes Earth's destruction with alien Ford Prefect. Don't panic! Towels, dolphins, and the answer is 42. The funniest sci-fi ever written.
classic: Adams turned philosophy into comedy. 'Don't Panic' and '42' entered popular culture. Brilliant satire of bureaucracy, technology, and the search for meaning wrapped in absurd humor.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
desc: Envoy Genly Ai visits planet Gethen where people are ambisexual. Le Guin explores gender, politics, and what makes us human through brilliant world-building.
classic: Le Guin's masterpiece won Hugo and Nebula. Revolutionary exploration of gender and sexuality decades ahead of its time. Profound anthropological sci-fi.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
desc: A dystopia controlled through pleasure rather than pain. Soma, conditioning, and manufactured happiness. Huxley's nightmare of consumerism and entertainment as control.
classic: Huxley's vision of control through distraction, not oppression, proves more accurate than Orwell's 1984. Chillingly relevant in our social media age.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
desc: Billy Pilgrim becomes unstuck in time, experiencing the firebombing of Dresden and alien abduction simultaneously. "So it goes." Vonnegut's anti-war masterpiece.
classic: Vonnegut's semi-autobiographical novel makes war's horror bearable through dark humor and sci-fi. 'So it goes' repeated 106 times makes death's frequency unbearable and inevitable.

title: The Martian Chronicles
author: Ray Bradbury
desc: Interconnected stories of Mars colonization. Humans destroy Martian civilization and themselves. Bradbury's poetic sci-fi warns against repeating Earth's mistakes.
classic: Bradbury wrote poetry disguised as science fiction. His Mars is a metaphor for indigenous destruction and human folly. Beautiful, haunting, and prescient.

title: Starship Troopers
author: Robert A. Heinlein
desc: Johnny Rico fights alien Bugs in powered armor. Military service, citizenship, and duty. Heinlein's controversial novel sparked endless political debate.
classic: Heinlein's most controversial work. Is it fascist propaganda or satire? The debate continues. Regardless, it revolutionized military sci-fi and influenced everything from Halo to Warhammer 40K.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
desc: Holden Caulfield's weekend in New York after expulsion from prep school. Teenage alienation, phonies, and protecting innocence. The voice of adolescent angst.
classic: Holden's voice captured teenage disillusionment like nothing before. Banned repeatedly, beloved eternally. Salinger's only novel made 'phony' and the red hunting hat cultural touchstones.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
desc: Scout Finch watches her father Atticus defend a black man falsely accused of rape in 1930s Alabama. Courage, racism, and childhood innocence meeting evil.
classic: Lee's only novel won the Pulitzer Prize. Atticus Finch represents moral courage. The novel's exploration of racism, justice, and empathy through a child's eyes remains essential reading.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
desc: Jay Gatsby's obsessive love for Daisy Buchanan against Jazz Age excess. The green light, parties, and the corruption of the American Dream. Literary perfection.
classic: Fitzgerald's prose is flawless. Every sentence sparkles. The green light, Doctor T.J. Eckleburg's eyes, and Gatsby's parties symbolize the American Dream's promise and corruption.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
desc: Captain Ahab's obsessive hunt for the white whale that took his leg. Ishmael narrates the voyage of the Pequod to doom. Whaling, philosophy, and revenge.
classic: The great American novel. Ahab's pursuit of the white whale is the ultimate metaphor for obsession and mankind's battle with nature. Dense, philosophical, and unforgettable.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
desc: Huck and escaped slave Jim raft down the Mississippi. Freedom, friendship, and moral development. Twain's masterpiece tackles racism and conscience.
classic: Hemingway said all American literature comes from this book. Huck's moral growth - choosing to help Jim despite society - is profound. Twain's vernacular voice revolutionized American literature.

title: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
desc: Hester Prynne wears the scarlet 'A' for adultery in Puritan Boston. Hidden father, revenge, and guilt. Hawthorne explores sin, guilt, and hypocrisy.
classic: Hawthorne's psychological insight into guilt and hypocrisy makes this Puritan tale timeless. The scarlet letter's meaning evolves throughout. Dense but brilliant.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
desc: The Joad family flees the Dust Bowl for California. Poverty, exploitation, and resilience during the Depression. Steinbeck's Pulitzer Prize-winning epic.
classic: Steinbeck's masterpiece of the Great Depression. The Joads' journey exposes American inequality and corporate greed. Ma Joad's strength and the novel's anger at injustice still resonate.

title: East of Eden
author: John Steinbeck
desc: Two families in Salinas Valley retell Cain and Abel. Good, evil, and choice. Steinbeck's longest novel explores timshel - 'thou mayest' - free will.
classic: Steinbeck's most ambitious novel. The Cain and Abel story retold across generations. 'Timshel' - thou mayest - gives humanity the power to choose good or evil.

title: Invisible Man
author: Ralph Ellison
desc: An unnamed black narrator's journey from Southern college to Harlem activism to invisibility. Race, identity, and being unseen in America. Ellison's only novel.
classic: Ellison's masterpiece of African American identity won the National Book Award. The invisible man is unseen because people refuse to see him - powerful metaphor for racism's dehumanization.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
desc: Sethe is haunted by her dead daughter Beloved after escaping slavery. Morrison's ghost story confronts slavery's trauma and the price of freedom.
classic: Morrison won the Pulitzer for this shattering novel. Slavery's psychological horror - Sethe's choice to kill her child rather than return her to slavery - is unbearable and necessary to confront.

title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
desc: Sherlock Holmes investigates a supernatural hound on Dartmoor. Gothic atmosphere, family curse, and brilliant deduction. The best Holmes novel.
classic: Conan Doyle's best Holmes novel combines gothic horror with detective brilliance. The hound, the moor, and Holmes's deduction showcase why Sherlock remains the ultimate detective.

title: Murder on the Orient Express
author: Agatha Christie
desc: Poirot solves a murder on a snowbound train. Twelve suspects, one victim, and Christie's most famous twist. Brilliant puzzle mystery.
classic: Christie's masterpiece has the perfect twist. Everyone did it! Poirot's solution is both shocking and morally complex. The locked-room mystery perfected.

title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie
desc: Ten strangers invited to an island are murdered one by one according to a nursery rhyme. No one is innocent. Christie's darkest, best novel.
classic: Christie's best-selling novel. Ten Little Soldiers and an empty island. The twist is brilliant. The judge's revelation is chilling. Suspense perfection.

title: The Maltese Falcon
author: Dashiell Hammett
desc: Sam Spade searches for a priceless statuette while navigating murder, lies, and femme fatales. Hard-boiled detective fiction defined.
classic: Hammett invented the hard-boiled detective. Sam Spade's cynical morality and the search for the black bird created film noir and modern detective fiction.

title: The Big Sleep
author: Raymond Chandler
desc: Philip Marlowe investigates blackmail and murder in Los Angeles. Chandler's complex plot and brilliant prose created the quintessential private eye.
classic: Chandler's prose is poetry. Marlowe's knight-errant in a corrupt world defined the PI genre. The plot is famously confusing; the atmosphere is perfect.

title: Romeo and Juliet
author: William Shakespeare
desc: Star-crossed lovers from feuding families love and die in Verona. Tragedy, passion, and family hatred. Shakespeare's most famous romance.
classic: The ultimate love story. Romeo and Juliet's passion versus their families' hatred created every romance trope. 'What's in a name?' and balcony scenes defined romantic literature.

title: Hamlet
author: William Shakespeare
desc: Prince Hamlet seeks revenge for his father's murder. 'To be or not to be.' Ghosts, madness, and existential questions. Shakespeare's greatest tragedy.
classic: The most quoted play in English. Hamlet's psychology, doubt, and madness fascinate endlessly. 'To be or not to be' is philosophy's essential question in verse.

title: Macbeth
author: William Shakespeare
desc: Macbeth murders his way to the Scottish throne. Three witches, guilt, and 'Out damned spot!' Ambition destroys.
classic: Shakespeare's shortest, bloodiest tragedy. The Macbeths' descent into guilt-driven madness is terrifying. 'Is this a dagger which I see before me?' Ambition's cost explored perfectly.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
author: William Shakespeare
desc: Fairies, lovers, and actors collide in an enchanted forest. Puck's magic causes chaos. 'Lord, what fools these mortals be!' Shakespeare's magical comedy.
classic: Shakespeare's most magical comedy. Fairies, love potions, and Bottom's donkey head create delightful chaos. The play-within-a-play mocks bad theater hilariously.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
desc: Raskolnikov murders a pawnbroker to prove he's extraordinary. Guilt, philosophy, and redemption through Sonya's love. Dostoevsky's psychological masterpiece.
classic: Dostoevsky's exploration of guilt is unmatched. Can extraordinary men commit murder without consequence? Raskolnikov's psychological torture and redemption through suffering is profound.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
desc: Three brothers - intellectual Ivan, passionate Dmitri, spiritual Alyosha - and their father's murder. God, free will, and morality explored through family drama.
classic: Dostoevsky's final novel is his masterpiece. The Grand Inquisitor chapter alone is worth reading. Faith, doubt, and morality debated with unprecedented depth.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
desc: Anna leaves her husband for Count Vronsky. Parallel story of Levin's search for meaning. Love, society, and fate. Tolstoy's greatest novel.
classic: Tolstoy said 'all happy families are alike...' Anna's tragedy and Levin's spiritual journey create literature's most perfect novel according to many critics. Every scene matters.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
desc: Russian aristocratic families during Napoleon's invasion. Pierre, Andrei, and Natasha's stories weave through history. Epic doesn't begin to describe it.
classic: One of the longest novels ever written and one of the greatest. Tolstoy mixes history, philosophy, and intimate human drama into an unmatched epic.

title: The Little Prince
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
desc: A pilot meets a little prince from asteroid B-612. A rose, a fox, and lessons about love. Philosophical fable for all ages.
classic: 'What is essential is invisible to the eye.' Saint-Exupéry's fable about love, loneliness, and what matters hides profound wisdom in a children's story. The fox's lesson is unforgettable.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
desc: Jean Valjean's redemption from convict to saint. Javert's pursuit, Cosette's rescue, the French Revolution. Hugo's massive novel of mercy and justice.
classic: Hugo's epic of redemption spans decades. Valjean's transformation from bitter convict to saintly father is one of literature's greatest character arcs. The barricade scene is unforgettable.

title: The Hunchback of Notre-Dame
author: Victor Hugo
desc: Quasimodo loves Esmeralda in medieval Paris. Beauty, ugliness, and cathedral bells. Hugo's gothic masterpiece saved Notre-Dame cathedral.
classic: Hugo's novel actually saved Notre-Dame from demolition! Quasimodo and Esmeralda's tragedy explores beauty, obsession, and injustice through gothic drama.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
desc: Meursault shoots an Arab 'because of the sun.' His trial and execution explore absurdism. Camus's existential masterpiece.
classic: Camus's absurdist novel questions meaning itself. Meursault's emotional detachment and random murder explore life's meaninglessness. Short, shocking, philosophical.

title: All Quiet on the Western Front
author: Erich Maria Remarque
desc: German soldiers in WWI trenches. Paul Baumer and friends lose innocence and lives. The greatest anti-war novel ever written.
classic: Remarque's WWI masterpiece shows war's horror without glory. Paul's generation is destroyed by trenches, shells, and gas. The ending is devastating. Essential reading.

title: The Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
desc: Gregor Samsa wakes as a giant insect. His family's reaction and his isolation explore alienation. Kafka's absurdist masterpiece.
classic: Kafka's nightmare begins 'As Gregor Samsa awoke one morning from uneasy dreams he found himself transformed into a gigantic insect.' Absurd premise becomes profound metaphor for alienation.

title: The Giver
author: Lois Lowry
desc: Jonas receives memories in a colorless, emotionless society. Pain, pleasure, color, and choice flood in. Lowry's dystopia is subtle and profound.
classic: Lowry's seemingly perfect community hides horrifying conformity. Jonas's awakening to color, emotion, and memory shows totalitarianism's true cost - humanity itself.

title: Number the Stars
author: Lois Lowry
desc: Annemarie helps hide her Jewish friend Ellen during Nazi occupation of Denmark. Brave girl, terrifying times. Lowry's WWII novel for middle readers is powerful.
classic: Lowry won the Newbery for this brave story of Danish resistance. Annemarie's courage saving Ellen demonstrates that ordinary people can resist evil. Essential Holocaust education.

title: Bridge to Terabithia
author: Katherine Paterson
desc: Jess and Leslie create imaginary kingdom Terabithia. Leslie's death devastates. Paterson's novel about friendship, imagination, and grief.
classic: Paterson's Newbery winner doesn't shy from tragedy. Leslie's unexpected death and Jess's grief process are real and raw. The imaginary kingdom makes the loss more poignant.

title: Roll of Thunder, Hear My Cry
author: Mildred D. Taylor
desc: Cassie Logan and her family face racism in Mississippi during the Depression. The Logan family's pride and resistance to oppression. Powerful historical novel.
classic: Taylor's Newbery winner shows racism through a child's eyes. The Logans' resistance and dignity in the face of violence and injustice is inspiring and essential reading.

title: The Outsiders
author: S.E. Hinton
desc: Greasers versus Socs in 1960s Oklahoma. Ponyboy, Johnny, and Dally. 'Stay gold, Ponyboy.' Hinton wrote this at 16 and created YA literature.
classic: Hinton was 16 when she wrote this! 'Stay gold' and the Greasers created the entire YA genre. Class warfare and teenage identity explored with authenticity no adult could match.

title: The Phantom Tollbooth
author: Norton Juster
desc: Bored Milo drives a toy tollbooth into a magical world. Wordplay, mathematics, and the importance of learning. Brilliantly clever and funny.
classic: Juster's wordplay masterpiece teaches love of learning through adventure. The Doldrums, Digitopolis, and the rescued princesses Rhyme and Reason make thinking exciting.

title: A Separate Peace
author: John Knowles
desc: Gene and Finny's friendship at Devon School during WWII. Jealousy, betrayal, and guilt. Knowles's only famous novel is a classic of adolescent psychology.
classic: Gene's jealousy-driven betrayal of Finny is adolescent psychology perfected. The tree, the war's shadow, and guilt's power make this slim novel unforgettable.

title: The 39 Steps
author: John Buchan
desc: Richard Hannay stumbles into a spy conspiracy and must prove his innocence while being hunted. Fast-paced Scottish chase thriller that influenced all spy fiction.
classic: Buchan invented the 'innocent man wrongly accused' thriller. Hitchcock's film made it famous, but the book's breakneck pace and Scottish setting thrill. The original spy chase.

title: The Riddle of the Sands
author: Erskine Childers
desc: Two friends discover German invasion plans while sailing. The first spy thriller ever written. Sailing, espionage, and patriotism.
classic: The book that invented the spy thriller genre in 1903! Childers's nautical detail and pre-WWI invasion fears created a new genre. Every spy novel owes a debt to this.

title: The Day of the Jackal
author: Frederick Forsyth
desc: An assassin is hired to kill Charles de Gaulle. Detective versus killer in a tense race. Forsyth's documentary-style thriller is gripping despite knowing the outcome.
classic: Forsyth's debut is thriller perfection. Despite knowing de Gaulle survives, the Jackal's professionalism and the detective's pursuit create unbearable tension. Documentary realism in fiction.

title: The Hunt for Red October
author: Tom Clancy
desc: Soviet submarine captain defects to the US with a new stealth submarine. Cold War cat-and-mouse under the ocean. Clancy's technical detail is stunning.
classic: Clancy's debut launched the techno-thriller. His submarine warfare detail and Cold War tension captivated Reagan himself. Jack Ryan's first appearance began a franchise.

title: The Bourne Identity
author: Robert Ludlum
desc: Amnesiac Jason Bourne discovers he's an assassin while being hunted. Identity, conspiracy, and non-stop action. Ludlum's masterpiece of paranoia.
classic: Ludlum's amnesiac assassin created the modern action thriller. Bourne's fight to discover himself while being hunted defined the genre. The films made it iconic.

title: The Pillars of the Earth
author: Ken Follett
desc: Building a cathedral in 12th century England. Politics, love, and ambition across decades. Follett's epic medieval saga is immersive and brilliant.
classic: Follett's cathedral-building epic is historical fiction at its finest. Tom Builder's vision, Aliena's strength, and medieval politics create an unforgettable saga across generations.

title: Wolf Hall
author: Hilary Mantel
desc: Thomas Cromwell's rise in Henry VIII's court. Mantel's present-tense narrative brings Tudor England to vivid life. Anne Boleyn, Cardinal Wolsey, and power games.
classic: Mantel's Booker Prize winner revolutionized historical fiction. Her Cromwell is complex and sympathetic. Present tense and 'he' for Cromwell create immediate immersion. Brilliant.

title: I, Claudius
author: Robert Graves
desc: Emperor Claudius narrates Rome's corrupt imperial family. Murder, intrigue, and survival. Graves brings ancient Rome to scandalous life.
classic: Graves's Claudius is history's best unreliable narrator. The Roman Empire's corruption, Caligula's madness, and Claudius's unlikely survival create gripping pseudo-memoir.

title: The Name of the Rose
author: Umberto Eco
desc: Medieval monk William of Baskerville investigates murders in an Italian monastery. Philosophy, mystery, and manuscripts. Eco's intellectual thriller.
classic: Eco's medieval mystery is also semiotics lecture and philosophical treatise. Dense, brilliant, and rewarding. The library and manuscript mystery satisfy both intellect and suspense.

title: Shogun
author: James Clavell
desc: English sailor John Blackthorne becomes samurai in feudal Japan. Culture clash, honor, and survival. Clavell's epic immerses readers in 1600s Japan.
classic: Clavell's massive novel teaches Japanese culture through adventure. Blackthorne's transformation and Toranaga's political genius create epic historical fiction. Deeply researched and immersive.

title: True Grit
author: Charles Portis
desc: 14-year-old Mattie Ross hires Marshal Rooster Cogburn to avenge her father's murder. The Old West through a determined girl's eyes. Perfect prose.
classic: Portis's western is all about voice. Mattie's determination and Cogburn's grit create the best buddy-western ever. The Coen Brothers' film is faithful because the book is perfect.

title: Lonesome Dove
author: Larry McMurtry
desc: Two retired Texas Rangers drive cattle from Texas to Montana. Epic journey, friendship, and the dying Old West. McMurtry's Pulitzer Prize masterpiece.
classic: McMurtry's Pulitzer-winning epic is the definitive Western. Gus and Call's friendship, the cattle drive's hardships, and the West's end create the genre's masterpiece.

title: Blood Meridian
author: Cormac McCarthy
desc: The Kid joins a scalp-hunting gang in 1850s borderlands. Judge Holden, violence, and the West's darkness. McCarthy's brutal masterpiece.
classic: McCarthy's darkest novel shows the West as hell. Judge Holden is literature's most terrifying character. Beautiful, violent prose describes humanity's capacity for evil. Not for everyone, unforgettable for those who can handle it.

title: Pippi Longstocking
author: Astrid Lindgren
desc: Super-strong Pippi lives alone with a horse and monkey. No rules, total freedom, and wild adventures. Swedish classic of girl power.
classic: Lindgren's Pippi is the ultimate free child. Super-strong, wealthy, and parent-free, she does what she wants. Revolutionary female character who needs no rescuing.

title: Madeline
author: Ludwig Bemelmans
desc: Twelve little girls in two straight lines in Paris. Brave Madeline faces appendicitis and adventure. Rhyming picture book classic.
classic: 'In an old house in Paris that was covered with vines...' Bemelmans's rhyming tale and watercolor Paris made Madeline iconic. 'To the tiger in the zoo, Madeline just said Pooh Pooh!'

title: Goodnight Moon
author: Margaret Wise Brown
desc: A little bunny says goodnight to everything in the great green room. Soothing rhythm and repetition. Bedtime ritual in book form.
classic: Brown's bedtime classic has lulled millions to sleep. The rhythm, repetition, and clement Hurd's illustrations create the perfect bedtime ritual. Pure comfort.

title: The Cat in the Hat
author: Dr. Seuss
desc: Mischievous cat brings chaos to two bored children on a rainy day. Thing 1 and Thing 2 wreak havoc. Seuss's breakthrough book.
classic: Seuss revolutionized children's literature. Using only 236 different words, he created anarchic fun that taught kids to love reading. The Cat's chaos and cleanup thrill.

title: Green Eggs and Ham
author: Dr. Seuss
desc: Sam-I-Am tries to get his friend to try green eggs and ham. Written on a bet using only 50 different words. Seuss's masterpiece of repetition.
classic: Seuss's publisher bet he couldn't write a book with 50 words. He won. The repetition and rhythm make this perfect for early readers. Plus, trying new things!

title: How the Grinch Stole Christmas
author: Dr. Seuss
desc: The Grinch tries to steal Christmas from the Whos. His heart grows three sizes. Seuss's message that Christmas means more than presents.
classic: Seuss's Christmas classic shows that Christmas doesn't come from a store. The Grinch's redemption and heart growth three sizes became cultural touchstones. Perfect holiday message.

title: The Lorax
author: Dr. Seuss
desc: The Lorax speaks for the trees against the Once-ler's greed. Environmental warning in rhyme. 'Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot...'
classic: Seuss's environmental warning gets more relevant yearly. The Once-ler's destruction and the Lorax's advocacy for trees created eco-awareness for kids. Prophetic.

title: Oh, The Places You'll Go!
author: Dr. Seuss
desc: Life's journey from success to failure to success. Graduates everywhere receive this. Seuss's most famous advice book.
classic: The ultimate graduation gift. Seuss's advice about life's ups and downs in rhythm and rhyme. 'You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.'

title: Corduroy
author: Don Freeman
desc: Teddy bear Corduroy searches for his missing button so a girl will buy him. Department store adventure and unconditional love.
classic: Freeman's bear wanting to be loved despite his flaws resonates. Lisa buying Corduroy anyway teaches acceptance. The button hunt adventure and friendship warm hearts.

title: Harold and the Purple Crayon
author: Crockett Johnson
desc: Harold draws his own adventure with a purple crayon. Imagination creates reality. Minimalist brilliance.
classic: Johnson's minimalist masterpiece about imagination creating reality. Harold draws himself into and out of adventures. The purple line and blank space make anything possible.

title: Curious George
author: H.A. Rey
desc: Curious monkey George has adventures with the Man in the Yellow Hat. Curiosity leads to chaos and fun.
classic: Rey's curious monkey got into trouble for 75+ years. George's mishaps from curiosity teach problem-solving and forgiveness. Timeless monkey mischief.

title: Make Way for Ducklings
author: Robert McCloskey
desc: Mrs. Mallard leads her ducklings through Boston traffic to the Public Garden. Charming New England tale.
classic: McCloskey's bronze ducklings still grace Boston's Public Garden. His detail of Boston and mother duck's determination charmed generations. Regional classic gone universal.

title: The Story of Ferdinand
author: Munro Leaf
desc: Bull Ferdinand prefers smelling flowers to fighting. Anti-violence message wrapped in Spanish bull story.
classic: Leaf's pacifist bull refused to fight when expected. Published before WWII, Ferdinand's flower-sniffing over fighting carried powerful anti-violence message. Simple, profound.

title: Caps for Sale
author: Esphyr Slobodkina
desc: Peddler's caps are stolen by monkeys who mimic him. Getting them back through clever thinking.
classic: Slobodkina's tale of monkey mischief and problem-solving delights. The stacked caps and monkey mimicry create perfect toddler story with satisfying resolution.

title: The Once and Future King
author: T.H. White
desc: King Arthur's life from boy to king to tragic end. Merlin, Lancelot, Guinevere, and Camelot. White's definitive Arthurian retelling.
classic: White's Arthur is the definitive version. Young Arthur with Merlin, Knights of the Round Table, and Camelot's glory and fall. 'Might for Right' philosophy and tragedy.

title: The Sword in the Stone
author: T.H. White
desc: Young Arthur (Wart) is tutored by Merlin and pulls the sword from the stone. First part of Once and Future King. Disney adapted this.
classic: White's young Arthur learning from Merlin is delightful. Transformed into animals for lessons, pulling the sword, becoming king. Disney's film introduced millions to this charming start.

title: The Wizard of Earthsea
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
desc: Young wizard Ged releases a shadow and must hunt it across Earthsea. Coming-of-age fantasy about facing your darkness. Le Guin's masterpiece.
classic: Le Guin's Earthsea trilogy begins perfectly. Ged's pride releasing the shadow and his journey to face it create deep fantasy. True names, magic's cost, and maturity.

title: The Dark Is Rising
author: Susan Cooper
desc: Will Stanton discovers he's an Old One on his 11th birthday. Battle between Light and Dark in English countryside. Cooper's atmospheric fantasy.
classic: Cooper's sequence blends Arthurian legend with modern England. Will's discovery of power and destiny feel authentic. The Dark's menace and Light's nobility create compelling mythology.

title: The Princess Bride
author: William Goldman
desc: True love, revenge, and adventure. Westley and Buttercup, Inigo Montoya's revenge, and 'as you wish.' Goldman's perfect fairy tale parody.
classic: Goldman's frame narrative (fake S. Morgenstern abridgment) and perfect adventure blend. 'Hello. My name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die.' The film is perfect because the book is.

title: Stardust
author: Neil Gaiman
desc: Young man crosses into Faerie to fetch a fallen star for his love. The star is a woman. Gaiman's adult fairy tale.
classic: Gaiman's fairy tale for adults blends Victorian England and Faerie perfectly. Yvaine the star-woman and Tristan's quest create romantic fantasy with darkness and humor.

title: American Gods
author: Neil Gaiman
desc: Old gods battle new gods for worship in America. Shadow works for mysterious Mr. Wednesday. Gaiman's modern mythology masterpiece.
classic: Gaiman imagines gods as immigrants needing worship to survive. Old gods (Odin, Anansi) versus new (Media, Technology). American identity and belief explored through fantasy.

title: Good Omens
author: Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett
desc: Angel and demon team up to prevent the apocalypse. The Antichrist was switched at birth. Hilarious collaboration between fantasy masters.
